scopecontent.p: The collection consists of materials related to the Brisbane and Popovic families, compiled primarily by Daniel J. Popovic. Family members lived in Philadelphia, Ohio, New York, and New Jersey. A series of wire bound notebooks function as scrapbooks, with personal correspondence and correspondence related to genealogical research, greeting cards, and ephemera. Many items include additional annotations. The collection also includes notes on the genealogy of Captain John Brisbane (1730-1822) of Pennsylvania and his descendants, including narrative and pedigrees, and extensive commentary by the author. Sources are generally indicated and include vital records, obituaries, and newspaper clippings. There is also documentation related to Daniel Popovic's work as a lay minister and cantor in the Catholic Church, including writings on religious topics. There is also a good deal of photographic documentation, including two large photograph albums and a number of smaller albums. The albums mainly contain family photos, but several albums consist of photos of the artwork of Beverly Rae Brisbane Popovic (1925-1999). Most photos are identified.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
